fields.name: WidgetSet
fields.label: WidgetSet
fields.description: Indicates that the user wants to select an existing Vega spec on a report.  This allows users to 're-use' or copy from widgets already done.  No link is stored to the original specification.

fields.name: BarChart
fields.label: BarChart
fields.description: Allows the user to select a BarChart template, that is preformatted, and insert only a few standard fields like X and Y axis.

fields.name: PieChart
fields.label: PieChart
fields.description: Allows the user to select a PieChart template, that is preformatted, and insert only a few standard fields like X and Y axis.

fields.name: LineChart
fields.label: LineChart
fields.description: Allows the user to select a LineChart template, that is preformatted, and insert only a few standard fields like X and Y axis.

fields.name: Custom
fields.label: Custom
fields.description: Allows the user to insert a Custom Vega spec. No validation (other than against the Vega schema) is done.  This allows the user to create any spec that possibly with Vega

fields.name: BarChart
fields.label: BarChart
fields.description: The type of graph in a Widget is a BarChart.

fields.name: PieChart
fields.label: PieChart
fields.description: The type of graph in a Widget is a PieChart.

fields.name: LineChart
fields.label: LineChart
fields.description: The type of graph in a Widget is a LineChart.

fields.name: None
fields.label: None
fields.description: Shadow around the container of a Widget shown on the Dashboard.  It is in CSS format, for example 2px 2px 12px black  (the widths are top, right, bottom, left).

fields.name: 2px 2px 12px black
fields.label: Black
fields.description: Shadow around the container of a Widget shown on the Dashboard.  It is in CSS format, for example 2px 2px 12px black  (the widths are top, right, bottom, left).

fields.name: 2px 2px 12px gray
fields.label: Gray
fields.description: Shadow around the container of a Widget shown on the Dashboard.  It is in CSS format, for example 2px 2px 12px black  (the widths are top, right, bottom, left).

fields.name: 2px 2px 12px white
fields.label: White
fields.description: Shadow around the container of a Widget shown on the Dashboard.  It is in CSS format, for example 2px 2px 12px black  (the widths are top, right, bottom, left).

fields.name: transparent
fields.label: None
fields.description: Border of the Widget container.  It can be a think line, or none.

fields.name: 1px solid black
fields.label: Thin Black
fields.description: Border of the Widget container.  It can be a think line, or none. It is provided in CSS format, ie 1px solid black.

fields.name: 3px solid black
fields.label: Thick Black
fields.description: Border of the Widget container.  It can be a think line, or none. It is provided in CSS format, ie 1px solid black.

fields.label: Thin White
fields.description: Border of the Widget container.  It can be a think line, or none. It is provided in CSS format, ie 1px solid black.

fields.description: Border of the Widget container.  It can be a think line, or none. It is provided in CSS format, ie 1px solid black.

fields.description: Border of the Widget container.  It can be a think line, or none. It is provided in CSS format, ie 1px solid black.

fields.description: Border of the Widget container.  It can be a think line, or none. It is provided in CSS format, ie 1px solid black.

fields.name: 1px solid gray
fields.label: Thin Gray
fields.description: Border of the Widget container.  It can be a think line, or none. It is provided in CSS format, ie 1px solid black.

fields.name: normal
fields.label: Normal
fields.description: Weight of the font in the text inside the Widget container.  It is provided in CSS format, ie normal.

fields.name: bold
fields.label: Bold
fields.description: Weight of the font in the text inside the Widget container.  It is provided in CSS format, ie normal.

fields.name: None
fields.label: None
fields.description: Margin around the text in the Widget container.  This is specified in CSS format, ie 5px 5px 5px 5px.

fields.name: Small
fields.label: 5px 5px 5px 5px
fields.description: Margin around the text in the Widget container.  This is specified in CSS format, ie 5px 5px 5px 5px.

fields.name: Medium
fields.label: 20px 20px 20px 20px
fields.description: Margin around the text in the Widget container.  This is specified in CSS format, ie 5px 5px 5px 5px.

fields.name: Large
fields.label: 50px 50px 50px 50px
fields.description: Margin around the text in the Widget container.  This is specified in CSS format, ie 5px 5px 5px 5px.

fields.name: None
fields.label: None
fields.description: Padding for the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie 5px 5px 5px 5px.

fields.name: 5px 5px 5px 5px
fields.label: Small
fields.description: Padding for the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie 5px 5px 5px 5px.

fields.name: 20px 20px 20px 20px
fields.label: Medium
fields.description: Padding for the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie 5px 5px 5px 5px.

fields.name: 50px 50px 50px 50px
fields.label: Large
fields.description: Padding for the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie 5px 5px 5px 5px.

fields.name: relative
fields.label: Relative
fields.description: Position (relative or absolute) of the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie relative.

fields.name: absolute
fields.label: Absolute
fields.description: Position (relative or absolute) of the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie relative.

fields.name: left
fields.label: Left
fields.description: Alignment (left, center, right) of the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie left.

fields.name: center
fields.label: Center
fields.description: Alignment (left, center, right) of the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie left.

fields.name: right
fields.label: Right
fields.description: Alignment (left, center, right) of the text in a Widget container.  This is in CSS format, ie left.

fields.name: ../assets/coffee.jpg
fields.label: Coffee
fields.description: Images that may be used in the image portion of a Widget container.  The files live in the src/assets sub-folder, thus the url starts with ../
